Everit - LQMG Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2016-04-27  | Version: 4.0.0
Overview
  • Introduction
  • Goals
Project Documentation
  • Project Information

lqmg:generate

Full name:

org.everit.persistence:lqmg-maven-plugin:4.0.0:generate

Description:

Generates QueryDSL Metadata classes from Liquibase schema files.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • Requires dependency resolution of artifacts in scope: compile+runtime.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
capability String - The expression of the schema that should be the starting point of the generation. Expressions references to the name of a "liquibase.schema" capability of a bundle. E.g. If the bundle has "Provide-Capability: liquibase.changelog;liquibase.changelog=mySchema", the value of this property should be simply "mySchema". It is possible to append filter to the expression. E.g.: mySchema;filter:=("someAttribute=someValue").
User property is: lqmg.capability.
outputFolder String - The folder where source will be generated to.
Default value is: src/main/generated/java.
User property is: lqmg.outputFolder.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
configFile String - The path of the main configuration XML. Optional. If defined, the naming rules in this XML have higher priority than the ones specified in the bundles.
User property is: lqmg.configFile.
defaultSchema String - Default schema that appears in the generated Metadata classes. The schema of tables and views might be overridden in the changelog files directly.
Default value is: ${project.artifactId}.
User property is: lqmg.defaultSchema.
hackWires boolean - If true, bundles that cannot be resolved are re-deployed in the way that their unsatisfied requirements are changed to be optional.
Default value is: true.
User property is: lqmg.hackWires.
innerClassesForKeys boolean - Whether to generate inner classes in Metadata classes for primary and foreign keys or not.
Default value is: true.
User property is: lqmg.innerClassesForKeys.
packages String - Comma separated list of packages that should be generated. If not defined, all packages will be generated.
User property is: lqmg.packages.
project MavenProject - The MavenProject which call the lqmg-maven-plugin.
User property is: executedProject.

Parameter Details

capability:

The expression of the schema that should be the starting point of the generation. Expressions references to the name of a "liquibase.schema" capability of a bundle. E.g. If the bundle has "Provide-Capability: liquibase.changelog;liquibase.changelog=mySchema", the value of this property should be simply "mySchema". It is possible to append filter to the expression. E.g.: mySchema;filter:=("someAttribute=someValue").
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: lqmg.capability

configFile:

The path of the main configuration XML. Optional. If defined, the naming rules in this XML have higher priority than the ones specified in the bundles.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.configFile

defaultSchema:

Default schema that appears in the generated Metadata classes. The schema of tables and views might be overridden in the changelog files directly.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.defaultSchema
  • Default: ${project.artifactId}

hackWires:

If true, bundles that cannot be resolved are re-deployed in the way that their unsatisfied requirements are changed to be optional.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.hackWires
  • Default: true

innerClassesForKeys:

Whether to generate inner classes in Metadata classes for primary and foreign keys or not.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.innerClassesForKeys
  • Default: true

outputFolder:

The folder where source will be generated to.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • User Property: lqmg.outputFolder
  • Default: src/main/generated/java

packages:

Comma separated list of packages that should be generated. If not defined, all packages will be generated.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: lqmg.packages

project:

The MavenProject which call the lqmg-maven-plugin.
  • Type: org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject
  • Required: No
  • User Property: executedProject
